label: Folder 44: Newspaper Article 21
description: News and Courier article (Feb. 5, 1951), "Revised Traffic Plan Goes in Effect Today."  Evening Post article (Feb. 6, 1951), "Several Minor Changes Made in New Traffic Plan."

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: Traffic Charleston, S, C  King  street  traffic   began  flowing   south, again  at   6   o clock  this  morning as the city"s revised traf-  ,., fie   pattern   began   a ,90-day   tria  period.  while a number of other changes  went into effect at the same time,  the direction of traffic flow in King  street-heai"t of the city"s retai  business-was the major, issue in  the Smith-Dibbe plan which started abor Day and ended this  morning.  King street reverts to its exac  status of five months ago. It becomes one-way southbound from  Calhoun street to Broad street and  two-way esewhere.  probably the" second most important change today is that Meeting street, one-way southbound for  the ast; five months, is restored as  a two-way express street throughout its ength.  several poype-men were scheduled to be on duty at, vita traffic contro points during rush  hours this morning and this afternoon in an .effort to eiminate as  much confusion as possibe.  Here are the other major  changes:  North Market street, now one-  "iyay least bound, and South Market  street, now one-way westbound,  will both become two-way streets.  Changes and new restrictions  on downtown parking will eiminate  about 100 metered parking  spaces.  There will be no parking at any  time in King street between Calhoun and. Broad streets, excepting  for bus stops, and trucks loading  and unoading before 1 p. m. ony.  There will b.e no parking on the  least side of King between Calhoun and Grove street and  no parking on the west side of  King between Grove and Mount  pleasant street. These atter restrictions will be effective only during the daytime, and parking will  be aowed after 6 p, m. on King  above Calhoun.  There will be no parking at any  time  on  the  least  side  of -Meeting  street   between   ee   and   Broad  streets.  There will be no parking at any  time on the west side of Rutledge  avenue from Mount pleasant-, street  to   Race   street.  The South Carolina Eectric and  Gas complany announced the following route changes made necessary   by   the   switch:  King street-The "Citade ine-  From Congress street, buses will  proceed south in King to Broad,  least in Broad to Meeting, north in  Meeting to Calhoun, thence . west  to King and north on the present  "route. ,  . Rutledge-Grove and Rutledge-  Heriot ines-From Rutledge avenue buses will go least in Wentworth to King, south in King to  Broad, least in Broad to Meeting,  north in Meeting to Wentworth, west in Wentworth to Ashley, thence north on the present  route.  Ashley River road, Pierpont, Riverand- Terrace-From Ashley river, buses will proceed least in Cannon to Rutledge, south in Rutledge  to Wentworth, least in Wentworth  to Meeting, north in Meeting to  Spring, west in Spring to the Ashley river and continue the present  route.  several Minor  Changes Made In  New Traffic plan  o  "3 H    if  Under the aternate traffic plan  that became effective yesterday a  number of changes were made that  have not been announced.  Former one-way streets that are  now two-way include New, Church  from Water to Pinckney; Hayne,  entire ength; Pinckney, entire  ength; Hase, entire ength, and  George,    entire    ength.  Two-way traffic also is moving  in North and South in Market  street, while King street is now oneway southbound from Calhoun to  South Battery.  Archdae street remains two-way.  Under the Smith Dibbe Aternate  plan, it would have been made oneway .southbound.
